security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and scaffolding meta-skill with no code execution, no network access, and no file access beyond its own directory structure. Contains bash scripts for validation and scaffolding that use only safe POSIX utilities.

content.value_statement: Building Claude Skills from domain documentation is time-consuming and error-prone. This meta-skill provides scaffolding templates, validation scripts, and a quality gate checklist so you can create production-ready skills in minutes instead of hours.
actual_capabilities: Generate skill directory structure from minimal or complete templates
Validate SKILL.md YAML frontmatter (name, description format)
Check markdown structure for required sections (When to Use, Boundaries, Quick Reference, Examples)
Enforce quality gate requirements with --strict mode
Refactor existing skills to reduce misfires and improve reliability
Extract reusable patterns from domain documentation
limitations: This is a meta-skill for building skills, not a domain skill itself
Cannot invent external facts; requires source material to reference
Validator is heuristic-based and assumes recommended section headings
Does not execute or test user code; only validates documentation

use_cases.title: Create new skills from docs
use_cases.description: Generate production-ready skill structures from API docs, specifications, or codebase READMEs in minutes.

use_cases.title: Validate skill quality gates
use_cases.description: Run validation scripts to ensure new skills meet naming, structure, and documentation standards before publishing.

use_cases.title: Refactor existing skills
use_cases.description: Fix documentation dumps, vague triggers, and missing boundaries to improve skill activation reliability.

prompt_templates.title: Create skill from API docs
prompt_templates.scenario: Turn API documentation into a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the claude-skills meta-skill to create a new skill called [skill-name] from these [API docs/repository]. Include SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter, Quick Reference with 10-20 copy/paste patterns, 3 reproducible examples, and references/ with index.md.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor vague skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use claude-skills to refactor [existing-skill-path]. The skill currently has [vague description/too long/missing boundaries]. Apply the anti-patterns guide to fix documentation dumps, vague triggers, and missing boundaries. Run validate-skill.sh --strict when done.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Run ./skills/claude-skills/scripts/validate-skill.sh [skill-path] --strict and report any errors, warnings, or suggestions. Iterate until validation passes.

prompt_templates.title: Build comprehensive skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a full-featured skill called [skill-name] using the complete template. Include getting_started.md, api.md, examples.md, and troubleshooting.md in references/. Use the quality checklist to ensure score >= 24.

output_examples.input: Create a skill called postgresql from the official PostgreSQL documentation
output: |-- SKILL.md (with frontmatter, triggers, boundaries, Quick Reference, Examples)

best_practices: Keep Quick Reference under 20 patterns with copy/paste commands; move long explanations to references/
Make frontmatter description decidable with concrete trigger keywords like 'when debugging PostgreSQL queries'
Add 'Not For / Boundaries' section to prevent skill misfires in irrelevant contexts
Include 3+ reproducible examples with input, steps, and expected acceptance criteria
anti_patterns: Documentation dumps in Quick Reference - users cannot scan or reuse paragraphs of text
Vague triggers like 'helps with databases' - activation becomes noisy and unpredictable
Missing boundaries - skill triggers in irrelevant contexts and over-promises capabilities
One giant SKILL.md file - split long content into references/ with index.md navigation

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude Skills work with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. Check platform documentation for skill upload instructions.

faq.question: What is the minimum viable skill?
faq.answer: A minimal skill needs only SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter (name + description) and one usage example.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Skills are activated by triggers in descriptions. Include concrete keywords and tasks that match user requests.

faq.question: Is data from this skill stored externally?
faq.answer: No. This meta-skill only creates and validates markdown files locally. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Validation failed with missing sections. What now?
faq.answer: Run with --strict to see required sections. Add: When to Use, Not For / Boundaries, Quick Reference, Examples, References, Maintenance.

faq.question: How does this compare to template-skill?
faq.answer: claude-skills is a production meta-skill with scaffolding, validation, and quality gates. template-skill is a basic starting point with minimal structure.
